phases.title: Phase I: First Reflection
questions: What does integrity mean to you?
When was the last time you apologized and meant it?
What truth are you currently avoiding?
Who taught you what it means to be honest?
What truth about yourself feels too dangerous to say out loud?
What value do you hold that most people don’t?

phases.title: Phase II: Ethical Disruption
questions: What do you stand for that you would defend no matter the cost?
What promise have you broken?
When did you know the right thing to do but didn’t do it?
What truth are you afraid to tell someone?
When have you enabled a lie?
When have you used “being right” as a reason not to be kind?
Who do you pretend to be when others are watching?
What would the person you aspire to be do differently?

phases.title: Phase III: Final Reckoning
questions: What uncomfortable truth would change you if you accepted it?
When have you compromised your values for acceptance?
What do you judge others for that you also do?
What is your most profound regret?
What is the hardest ethical choice you’ve had to make?
What responsibility have you neglected?
What would it take for you to compromise your integrity?

phases.title: Phase IV: The Hidden Current
questions: What secret craving do you carry that you’ve never explored?
When have you taken pleasure in having power over someone else?
What do you believe others secretly deserve, but won’t admit?
When have you confused control with protection?
What temptation would be hardest to resist in a position of trust?
